abstract: American law just enacted denying visa-free travel to Iranian citizens or anyone who has visited there in past five years provokes ire of Iranian officials, who view it as sanction in violation of recent nuclear agreement; say that visa changes, which US holds are to protect against Islamic State, should not apply to Shiite-majority Iran, which also opposes group.
lead_paragraph: Lawmakers behind the new limit on visa-free travel, which Iran calls an obstacle to the nuclear pact, warned the White House against exempting Iran.

headline.main: Tensions Rise Over U.S. Visa Measure That Could Affect Iran Nuclear Accord
headline.print_headline: Tensions With Iran Rise Over U.S. Visa Measure

snippet: Lawmakers behind the new limit on visa-free travel, which Iran calls an obstacle to the nuclear pact, warned the White House against exempting Iran.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
